required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transvaginal NOTES Nephrectomy Versus Conventional Laparoscopic Nephrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Transvaginal NOTES Nephrectomy Versus Conventional Laparoscopic Nephrectomy: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Gannan Medical University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Gannan Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Recent reports have suggested that transvaginal NOTES nephrectomy is feasible, yet comparative studies are lacking. The aim of this study was to compare the surgical outcomes of transvaginal NOTES nephrectomy to conventional laparoscopic nephrectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity of pain in motion (Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale (0-10)
primary_outcome.description: Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.description: The cosmetic result was assessed using a Patient Scar Assessment Questionnaire and Scoring System (PSAQ)
Sexual function was evaluated according to the Female Sexual Function Index

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative complication (classified using the Clavien-Dindo system)
secondary_outcome.description: Early (≤ 1 month) and late (> 1 month) complications were classified using the Clavien-Dindo system

arm_group.description: A 5- and 10-mm trocar were placed at the right and left medial margin of umbilicus. A lengthened 10-mm trocar was placed through the vagina into the abdominal cavity

One 10-mm trocar was inserted at the midclavicular line 2 cm below the umbilicus, another 10-mm periumbilical trocar was placed for the camera, and a 5- or 10-mm trocar was placed 3 cm below the costal margin

intervention.description: A 5- and 10-mm trocar were placed at the right and left medial margin of umbilicus. A lengthened 10-mm trocar was placed through the vagina into the abdominal cavity

One 10-mm trocar was inserted at the midclavicular line 2 cm below the umbilicus, another 10-mm periumbilical trocar was placed for the camera, and a 5- or 10-mm trocar was placed 3 cm below the costal margin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female sex,
- indication for nephrectomy due to benign or malignant kidney disease,
- age between 18 and 65 years, and
- legal competence
Exclusion Criteria:
- emergency surgery,
- contraindications to laparoscopic surgery,
- class IV or V as defined by the American Society for Anesthesiologists (ASA),
- body mass index (BMI) of > 30 kg/m2,
- advanced TNM staging (≥ T3),
- history of major abdominal surgery,
- gravidity or breast-feeding, and
- no written informed consent signed

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Gannan Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Gannan Medical University
